CreateDomain.document: This API is used to add a domain.
CreateDomain.name: Adds a domain

CreateRecord.document: This API is used to add a record.
CreateRecord.name: Adds a record

DeleteDomain.document: This API is used to delete a domain.
DeleteDomain.name: Deletes a domain

DeleteRecord.document: This API is used to delete a record.
DeleteRecord.name: Deletes a record

DescribeDomain.document: This API is used to get the information of a domain.
DescribeDomain.name: Gets the information of a domain

DescribeRecord.document: This API is used to get the information of a record.
DescribeRecord.name: Gets the information of a record

DescribeRecordList.document: This API is used to get the DNS records of a domain.
DescribeRecordList.name: Gets DNS records of a domain

ModifyDomainRemark.document: This API is used to set the remarks of a domain.
ModifyDomainRemark.name: Sets the remarks of a domain

ModifyDomainStatus.document: This API is used to modify the status of a domain.
ModifyDomainStatus.name: Modifies the status of a domain

ModifyRecord.document: This API is used to modify a record.
ModifyRecord.name: Modifies a record

members.document: Domain
members.name: Domain

members.document: The group ID of the domain. You can view the group information of this domain via the `DescribeDomainGroupList` API.
members.name: GroupId

members.document: Whether the domain is starred. Valid values: yes, no.
members.name: IsMark

members.document: Domain information
members.name: DomainInfo

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Domain
members.name: Domain

members.document: Record type, which is obtained through the record type API. The value contains uppercase letters, such as `A`.
members.name: RecordType

members.document: Record split zone, which is obtained through the record split zone API.
members.name: RecordLine

members.document: Record value, such as `IP : 200.200.200.200`, `CNAME : cname.dnspod.com`, and `MX : mail.dnspod.com`.
members.name: Value

members.document: Domain ID. The `DomainId` parameter has a higher priority than `Domain`. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` will be ignored.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: Host record such as `www`. If it is not passed in, it will be `@` by default.
members.name: SubDomain

members.document: Split zone ID, which is obtained through the record split zone API. The value is a string such as `10=1`. The `RecordLineId` parameter has a higher priority than `RecordLine`. If both of them are passed in, `RecordLineId` will be used first.
members.name: RecordLineId

members.document: MX priority, which is required for an MX record and will take effect if the record type is MX. Value range: 1–20.
members.name: MX

members.document: TTL. Value range: 1–604800. The minimum value varies by domain level.
members.name: TTL

members.document: Weight information, which is an integer between 0 and 100. It is supported only for enterprise VIP domains. `0` indicates not to pass in this parameter, i.e., not to set the weight.
members.name: Weight

members.document: Initial status of the record. Valid values: ENABLE, DISABLE. Default value: ENABLE. If `DISABLE` is passed in, the DNS record won't take effect, and the limit on round-robin DNS won't be verified.
members.name: Status

members.document: Record ID
members.name: RecordId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Domain
members.name: Domain

members.document: The domain ID. `DomainId` takes priority over `Domain`. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` is ignored. You can view all `Domain` and `DomainId` values via the `DescribeDomainList` API.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Domain
members.name: Domain

members.document: The record ID. You can view all DNS records and their IDs via the `DescribeRecordList` API.
members.name: RecordId

members.document: The domain ID. `DomainId` takes priority over `Domain`. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` is ignored. You can view all `Domain` and `DomainId` values via the `DescribeDomainList` API.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Domain
members.name: Domain

members.document: The domain ID. `DomainId` takes priority over `Domain`. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` is ignored. You can view all `Domain` and `DomainId` values via the `DescribeDomainList` API.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: Domain information
members.name: DomainInfo

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The domain for which DNS records are to be obtained.
members.name: Domain

members.document: The ID of the domain whose DNS records are requested. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` is ignored. You can view all `Domain` and `DomainId` values via the `DescribeDomainList` API.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: The host header of a DNS record. If this parameter is passed in, only the DNS record corresponding to this host header will be returned.
members.name: Subdomain

members.document: The type of DNS record, such as A, CNAME, NS, AAAA, explicit URL, implicit URL, CAA, or SPF record.
members.name: RecordType

members.document: The name of the split zone for which DNS records are requested. You can view split zones allowed by this domain via the `DescribeRecordLineList` API.
members.name: RecordLine

members.document: The ID of the split zone for which DNS records are requested. If `RecordLineId` is passed in, `RecordLine` is ignored. You can view split zones allowed by this domain via the `DescribeRecordLineList` API.
members.name: RecordLineId

members.document: The group ID passed in to get DNS records in the group.
members.name: GroupId

members.document: The keyword for searching for DNS records. Host headers and record values are supported.
members.name: Keyword

members.document: The sorting field. Available values: `name`, `line`, `type`, `value`, `weight`, `mx`, and `ttl,updated_on`.
members.name: SortField

members.document: The sorting type. Valid values: `ASC` (ascending, default), `DESC` (descending).
members.name: SortType

members.document: The offset. Default value: `0`.
members.name: Offset

members.document: The limit. It defaults to 100 and can be up to 3,000.
members.name: Limit

members.document: The record count info.
members.name: RecordCountInfo

members.document: The record list result.
members.name: RecordList

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Domain
members.name: Domain

members.document: The record ID. You can view all DNS records and their IDs via the `DescribeRecordList` API.
members.name: RecordId

members.document: The domain ID. `DomainId` takes priority over `Domain`. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` is ignored. You can view all `Domain` and `DomainId` values via the `DescribeDomainList` API.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: Record information
members.name: RecordInfo

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

Record weight.

members.name: MX

members.document: TTL value of the record.
members.name: TTL

members.document: Record status. Valid values: 0 (disabled); 1 (enabled).
members.name: Enabled

members.document:
D-Monitor status of the record.
"Ok" : The server is normal.
"Warn" : There is an alarm on this record, and the server returns 4XX.
"Down" : The server is down.
"" : D-Monitor is disabled for this record.
members.name: MonitorStatus

members.document:
Record remarks.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Remark

The record weight, which is required for round-robin DNS records.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Weight

members.document: The monitoring status of the record. Valid values: `OK` (normal), `WARN` (warning), and `DOWN` (downtime). It is empty if no monitoring is set or the monitoring is suspended.
members.name: MonitorStatus

members.document: The record remarks.
members.name: Remark

members.document: The record cache time.

The MX value, applicable to the MX record only.
